content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Search for a Mediterranean-style grilled fish recipe on Allrecipes that includes ingredients like olives, has at least a 4-star rating, and more than 25 reviews. Detail the ingredients, cooking method, and total time required for preparation and cooking.  Please interact with https://www.allrecipes.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To start searching for a Mediterranean-style grilled fish recipe with olives, I should use the search bar at the top of the Allrecipes page. The textbox for search is labeled [2], and after typing, I will click the search button [3].
Action: Type [2]; Mediterranean grilled fish olives
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results are displayed. The first two recipes ([9] and [10]) are directly related to Mediterranean-style grilled fish. I should click on one of them to check if it includes olives, has at least a 4-star rating, and more than 25 reviews.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Mediterranean Stuffed Swordfish" recipe has a 4.6-star rating and 57 reviews, meeting the rating and review requirements. Next, I need to check the detailed ingredients and cooking method to verify the presence of olives and gather the preparation and cooking time.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The prep time (15 mins), cook time (20 mins), and total time (35 mins) are visible now, which fulfills part of the task. I still need to locate and detail the ingredients and cooking method to confirm the presence of olives and cooking steps.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The ingredients section is visible, showing swordfish steak and olive oil, but I can't see the complete ingredient list yet. I need to scroll further down to view all ingredients and specifically confirm if olives are included.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: More ingredients are visible: olive oil, garlic, spinach, and feta. I still can't confirm the presence of olives yet. I also see the start of the directions, but need to see the full ingredient list and more of the cooking instructions to complete the task.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Cooking directions are visible and showing grilling steps, but the complete ingredient list (to confirm the presence of olives) was not visible in the last scroll. I need to check one more time for the lower part of the ingredient list or see all ingredients.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I can see the ingredients section again, which lists olive oil, garlic, spinach, and feta, but it does not include olives. Without olives explicitly listed, this recipe does not fully meet the task requirements.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am back at the search results or the main recipe page. Since the previous recipe did not include olives, I need to look for another Mediterranean-style grilled fish recipe that includes olives. I should scroll down to see more search results or recipes from the initial search.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current screen shows the recipe image and prep/cook/total time, but does not show more recipes or a way to select a different one. To proceed, I need to return to the search results and check other grilled fish recipes that might include olives.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.92
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There are multiple Mediterranean-style recipes in the search results. The second recipe "Branzino Mediterranean" (label [10]) appears to be another type of Mediterranean grilled fish and could potentially include olives and satisfy the requirements. I should check this recipe next for the required ingredients, star rating, and reviews.
Action: Click [10]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The Branzino Mediterranean recipe has a 4.8-star rating and 38 reviews, which meets the requirements. To confirm if it includes olives and to gather details on ingredients, cooking method, and time, I need to scroll down to view the full recipe details.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The image displays the Branzino Mediterranean recipe, and some ingredients are visually present (lemon, rosemary, possibly olives or red onions), but for a precise ingredient list, cooking method, and timing, I need to scroll further down past the image and ads to see the full recipe details.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.82
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Ingredients" section is now visible, and the first ingredient listed is "2 tablespoons olive oil, divided." However, not all ingredients are visible yet, so I need to scroll further down to review the complete ingredient list and look for olives (not just olive oil).
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The ingredients list is fully visible and does not include olives, only olive oil. Therefore, this recipe doesn't exactly meet the requirement for olives as an ingredient. However, I see the "Directions" section is just below the ingredients.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The directions are now partially visible and show the first steps of the recipe, involving olive oil and red onion. However, there is still no mention or visible evidence of olives in the method or ingredients, which continues to indicate this recipe does not fully meet the specified requirements. I should scroll further to review all steps, but it is unlikely olives will appear.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.88
Completion: 0.87
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Step 3 of the directions confirms that no olives are used at any point in the recipe. The main flavorings are lemon, rosemary, red onion, olive oil, white wine, lemon juice, and oregano. This recipe does not fulfill the “must include olives” requirement. I need to return to the recipe search results and look for another Mediterranean-style grilled fish recipe that contains olives.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.8

Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: <button> "Main menu for Allrecipes";	[1]: "Allrecipes", "Visit Allrecipes' homepage";	[2]: <input> "";	[3]: <button> "Click to search";	[4]: "Log In";	[7]: "Recipes";	[8]: "Seafood";	[9]: "Fish";	[15]: "4.8";	[16]: "38 Reviews";	[17]: "28 Photos";	[18]: <button> "Save", "Save Recipe";	[19]: <button> "Rate";	[20]: <button> "Print", "Print this article.";	[21]: <button> "Share";	[23]: <button> "Close";

content:
Thought: I am back on the Branzino Mediterranean recipe overview page, but this recipe does not include olives. To continue searching efficiently, I should modify my search terms in the search bar ([2]) to specifically include "grilled fish with olives" to increase my chances of finding a recipe meeting all requirements.
Action: Type [2]; grilled fish with olives mediterranean
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.8
token: : Type [2]; grilled fish with olives mediterranean
